meanings.definition: A person who compiles or edits a gazetteer.
meanings.sent1: The gazetteers worked hard to update the geographical information.
meanings.sent2: I found the name of the gazetteer in the book.
meanings.sent3: The gazetteers had a friendly competition to see who could compile the most accurate data.
meanings.sent4: She was a gazetteer, meticulously crafting each entry like a skilled artist.
meanings.sent5: The gazetteers were like detectives, uncovering hidden details about each location.

meanings.definition: A book or electronic database containing geographical information.
meanings.sent1: The gazetteers on the library shelf were filled with maps and facts.
meanings.sent2: I searched the gazetteers online to find the coordinates of the city.
meanings.sent3: The gazetteers on my phone helped me navigate through the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a gazetteer, storing every detail of the places she visited.
meanings.sent5: The gazetteers whispered secrets of distant lands, waiting to be explored.

meanings.definition: To publish or list in a gazetteer.
meanings.sent1: They gazetteered the new town in the latest edition.
meanings.sent2: I will gazetteer the historical sites in the upcoming publication.
meanings.sent3: He gazetteers with such enthusiasm that it inspires others to do the same.
meanings.sent4: The author gazetteered the ancient ruins with poetic descriptions.
meanings.sent5: She gazetteers with precision, ensuring every detail is accurately recorded.
